Take control of your screen\'s brightness. Low Brightness allows you to reduce your screen\'s illumination beyond the system\'s default minimum, perfect for comfortable viewing in dark environments.
Fine-tune the screen filter intensity to your exact preference. Find the perfect balance for reading, browsing, or watching videos in low light conditions.
Dim your screen further than ever before to reduce eye strain, especially during nighttime use or in dimly lit spaces. Enjoy a more comfortable viewing experience.
To dim your screen effectively across all apps, Low Brightness needs your permission to use the Accessibility Service.
Enhanced Comfort: We can apply a dimming overlay over other apps for a consistent low-brightness experience.
No Data Collection: This service is only used to control the screen overlay. Low Brightness does not collect, store, or share any of your personal data, typing, or interactions with other apps.
You Are in Control: You can disable this permission at any time through your phone\'s settings.

Allows the app to restart its services after the device boots so scheduled dimming continues to work.
Allows the app to draw overlay views over other apps, enabling the dimming layer.
Allows the app to modify system settings such as screen brightness.
Low Brightness lets you dim the screen beyond the system minimum for comfortable viewing in dark environments.
Why does the app need the overlay permission?
It allows the app to display a dimming overlay on top of other apps.
Why does the app request to modify system settings?
This permission lets the app adjust system brightness values so the filter can apply correctly.
Why is the boot permission required?
The app uses it to restore brightness and notifications after you restart the device.
Does the app work without internet?
Yes. Internet is only used for update checks and optional error reports.
All core features are free and open source. Donations are optional.
Can I change the overlay color?
Yes. You can select any color from the settings screen.
Why is there a persistent notification?
The notification keeps the dimming service running so it is not killed by the system.
